data.title: Obituaries – Page 12 – Iron Workers Local 721
data.text:
George HarachLifetime member – Ironworker

An Ironworker since May 1, 1956, George Harach passed away peacefully on Wednesday, January 30, 2019 at Lakeridge Health Ajax-Pickering Hospital, at the age of 90. Beloved husband of the late Olive. Father of Gail, Deborah and Glenn (Mari). Cherished grandfather of Jason (Danielle), Olivia and Melissa (Kevin). Proud great grandfather of Liam, Nolan, Bailey and Jillian. Predeceased by his siblings and survived by his sister Sylvia. George had a long and distinguished career with the iron Workers Local 721 Toronto, where he made lifelong friends. Proud member of St. John the Baptist Ukrainian Orthodox. https://www.armstrongfh.ca/memorials/george-harach/3708722/

Frank John BrolleyLifetime member – Ironworker

We are sad to announce that on November 19, 2018 we had to say goodbye to Frank John Brolley (Angus, Ontario). You can send your sympathy in the guestbook provided and share it with the family. You may also light a candle in honor of Frank John Brolley. He was predeceased by : his brother Ronnie; and his sister-in-law Anne. He is survived by : his children, Sean (Kerri) and Steven; and his siblings, Lenora Laycock (Harold), Larry (Anne) and Murray (Shirley). He is also survived by his many relatives and friends.

Dan “Magoo” McGillIronworker

It is with great sadness that the family of Danny McGill announce his sudden passing on Thursday, November 15, 2018 in his 63rd year. Beloved father of Justin Brown (McKenna) and his grandson Trew. Predeceased by his loving parents Bill and Sally McGill. Loving brother of Pat, Cathy Mathers, Brigid Van der Sande (George), Bob, Mike (Sandra), and Clair (Darlene). Predeceased by brothers Mark, Greg, Paul and John. Lovingly remembered by many nieces and nephews. His legacy will be continued by his brothers of 81. https://www.steckleygooderham.com/obituaries/Dan-Mcgill/

Charles ThompsonHonorary member – Ironworker

Charlie Thompson, an Ironworker since April 1, 1980, passed away on November 14, 2018 at the Rouge Valley Hospital-Centenary site. Beloved husband of Carol Carter and father to Holly Colleen Jean Poitras, loving grandpa to Justin and Brody, Vincent Robert George Thompson, and Quinlan, oldest brother to Leith, Bill, Kerry, Maureen, Lynne, Kevin, Melba and friend to many, Charlie was born on Dec 22, 1948 in Regina, Saskatchewan. Charlie was fearless ironworker who took pride in helping to build Canada. A big thank you is extended to the caring staff at the Centenary Hospital who cared for him until the end.

Peter MolnarIronworker

We were so blessed to call you our son, brother and father, but on Monday November 12 at 7pm after a tragic single vehicle accident which occured on October 27. At the age of 42, Peter succumbed to his injuries with his loving family by his bedside. Peter will forever be missed by his beautiful children Layla and Dylan Molnar and their mother Laura. Loved with an unending love by his supportive parents Peter and Marg Molnar, sister and brother-in-law Susan and Jerry Veens, niece and nephew Rachel and Nicholas, along with many aunts, uncles, cousins and his abundance of friends will always miss him. Peter followed in his father’s footsteps and became an ironworker and any opportunity Peter and his dad had they would share stories of their trade. Above everything, Peter’s life was dedicated to his children Layla and Dylan. Peter worked hard and played hard and those who knew Peter knew he could cheer up a crowd with his contagious laugh. He loved life, loved his music, his family and his friends and would drop anything to help a friend in need. Peter was a lover, a fighter and the best friend a person could have. https://gilpinfuneralchapel.com/book-of-memories/3654990/Molnar-Peter/service-details.php

Tommaso PirragliaLifetime member – Rodmen

Tommaso Pirraglia passed away peacefully at his home on October 18th, 2018 in the company of his wife of 61 years, Adriana. Tommaso was the proud father of Mario (Anne) and Christine. He was a loving grandfather to Daniella, Gabriela, Aaron, Daniel, Mykola and Peter. And, in one of the great joys of his last years, Tommaso welcomed a great grandchild, Max, into this world. Tommaso will be sorely missed by his sister Vittoria and his brothers Mario, Cosimo and Giovanni. Tommaso became a member of the small army of recent immigrants who built the city of Toronto. He became an Ironworker and was an active member of the Italian immigrant community. https://www.wardfuneralhomes.com/book-of-memories/3633339/pirraglia-tommaso/index.php

Daniel ParadisRodmen

It is with profound sadness that we announce the sudden passing of Daniel “Dan” Paradis on Wednesday, October 17, 2018 in his 50th year at Sunnybrook Hospital. He leaves behind his best friend and wife, Janet, his cherished sons Christopher (Jessica) and Alexander and his newborn grandson, Miller. He will be lovingly missed by his parents Delvina and Michel (predeceased) and dear sister Susanne (Eddie). His nieces and nephew, Amber (Cody), Jesse and Brittany and great nieces, Autumn and Emily will miss his fun loving spirit. Dan will also be deeply missed by his many aunts, uncles and cousins, in-laws, friends and colleagues of Local 721. https://www.dignitymemorial.com/en-ca/obituaries/courtice-on/daniel-paradis-8027021

Patrick Gregory TerrionIronworker

Former Maple Leaf player Greg Terrion, who played six seasons for Toronto during the 1980s, and an Ironworker at our Local since June 17, 2006, Greg Terrion passed away at his home, in Marmora, on Friday, September 28, 2018 in his 59th year. Husband of Cindy (Fox). He was the son of Patricia (Donohoe) and the late Wilfred Terrion, and father of Jason & Natasha, Madoc; Ryan & Jamie, Marmora and Tyson, Marmora He was the brother of Laurie Hainle, Marmora; Terry (Sarah), Uxbridge; Scott (Judy), Peterborough & Kevin, Peterborough and grandfather of Jessica, Lakelyn & Treyton.
